column10: There is no way to cross from the SW side of Beulah to the trail without crossing mid-road.; Mid-road, no means to cross over to walking trail without crossing road; There is no way to cross Beulah to get on trail so it becomes a game of frogger with speeding drivers
column21: There is no way to cross Beulah to get on trail so it becomes a game of frogger with speeding drivers

column10: There is no way to safely cross from south side of Beulah to the trail on the north side without running across and hoping cars are not speeding.  It is a matter of time before someone has an accident; No way to cross street to get on trail

On the stretch of Beulah north of Trap/Old Courthouse/Beaulah there is no safe way to cross road to get on the trail and cars are routinely speeding; Must cross street to get on trail/sidewalk; Speeding while pedestrian trying to cross road to sidewalk
column21: Speeding while pedestrian trying to cross road to sidewalk

column10: Only way to access trail on Beulah from SW side of street is to cross mid-block.  THere are no sidewalks or cross walks nearby and cars are always speeding.; In order to access the trail on Beulah we have to cross the street where people are speeding consistently.
column21: In order to access the trail on Beulah we have to cross the street where people are speeding consistently.

column10: Due to the lack of sidewalks in the area there is no way for residents on the west side of Beulah Rd (north of four corners - Trap, Old Courthouse, Beulah) to cross to the walking trail without running across the road.  Although the speed limit is 30mph, more often than not drivers are in excess of 45mph and making crossing the road a hazardous game of "Frogger".  My wife and I recently had our first child and it scares me to death to think about my wife crossing the road with the stroller trying to walk around our beautiful neighborhood.  I have been trying for three years to get this addressed by Supervisor Alcorn with no progress whatsoever (I don't even get email responses form his office anymore).

There are no sidewalks on the west side of Beualh Rd north of the four way intersection of Beulah, Old Courthouse and Trap.  In order to get on to the trail one must cross Beulah mid-road.  Speed limit is 30 MPH but most cars are traveling much faster.  My wife, dog, 10 month old and dog were out for a walk and a Jeep was driving at excessive speeds barely stopping in time for us to get across the road with the stroller.
column21: We have been trying to work with the county to implement some type of speed regulator (bumps, speed camera, etc) but we have gotten no where in 3 years with the county.  We keep being told VDOT is studying it.  Amazing that less than a mile down the road in Town of Vienna has speed bumps on Old Courthouse and numerous increased fine signage, speed monitors etc.
